newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-RANGERS SLIP SEES THEIR LEAD CUT TO FIVE POINTS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-RANGERS SLIP SEES THEIR LEAD CUT TO FIVE POINTS.

text.p: Rangers lead at the top of the Scottish premier division was cut to five points on Saturday when they drew 2-2 at Aberdeen and their only title challengers Celtic beat Hearts 2-0 at home.

The results leave Rangers -- seeking to emulate Celtic's record run of nine successive championships in the 1960s and 1970s -- on 68 points from 28 matches with Celtic on 63, also from 28. Dundee United are a distant third with 49 points.
Rangers went ahead at Aberdeen through Dane Michael Laudrup after only five minutes, but the home side pulled level through Antoine Kombouare after 35 minutes.

Aberdeen then went ahead after 57 minutes though an Andy Goram own goal when he dropped the ball over his own line at a high cross which carried in the wind. Craig Moore won Rangers a share of the points with a headed equaliser after 63 minutes, his first goal of the season.
Portuguese striker Jorge Cadete opened the scoring for Celtic at home to Hearts with Italian Paolo di Canio making it 2-0 in the second half.
The top teams in Scotland now have only eight league games to play with a possible title decider coming up on March 16 when Celtic play Rangers at Parkhead.
